Posts.Content: Dec 23, 2010 05:35PM LavenderNLace wrote: I think what you are feeling is pretty darn normal.  Yes, you have a loving husband, a roof over your head but you also have stage 4 bc.  That just sucks.  I've always been annoyed by people who say 'cancer is a gift cause I never would have met such wonderful people, realized such wonderful .... blah blah blah.'  Cancer is not a gift.  It is a thief, stealing time from the cancer patient and their loved ones.  Sorry if this makes you feel worse, it wasn't intended too.  I just get what you are saying.  Sometimes I feel like I have been robbed of what could have been.

Posts.Content: Jun 23, 2009 08:37AM LavenderNLace wrote: I agree with those who mentioned that you need to determine her hormone and her2 status before making a decision.  Since triple negative cancer does not benefit from drugs like tamoxifen/arimidex then chemotherapy is the ONLY line of defense.  If her tumor/cancer is er negative/pr negative/ her2 negative then I would think she would want to do some type of chemotherapy. The onco test is relatively new and that is another option to consider as well.  A tumor/mass over 2 cm is usually considered a large mass and the fact that she is staged at 2a. In the end, it is up to each individual what they wish to do.  Doctors can recommend but the decision rests with the patient.
